skill.name: testing
skill.description: Guide for testing practices and frameworks
skill.summary: Guide for testing practices and frameworks
skill.author: 5t111111

security_audit.summary: This skill is a pure documentation file providing testing guidance. No executable code, scripts, network calls, or file system access beyond its own content. The skill only contains markdown documentation about testing practices.

content.value_statement: Writing quality tests is essential for maintaining reliable software. This skill provides clear guidance on testing frameworks, test organization, and running tests efficiently in Deno projects.
actual_capabilities: Guide on using Deno's built-in testing framework
Recommendations for organizing test files with .test.ts extension
Best practices for writing comprehensive test cases
Instructions for running tests with mise run test
Guidance on covering edge cases and error handling
Suggestions for maintaining test quality before commits
limitations: Focused specifically on Deno projects and testing
Does not execute tests or provide automated testing workflows
Does not integrate with external CI/CD systems
Does not generate test cases automatically

use_cases.title: Set up test structure
use_cases.description: Organize test files in .test.ts format alongside source code with proper naming conventions

use_cases.title: Improve test coverage
use_cases.description: Write comprehensive tests covering edge cases, error handling, and all public functions

use_cases.title: Establish testing workflow
use_cases.description: Integrate test runs into development process using mise run test before commits

prompt_templates.title: Basic test setup
prompt_templates.scenario: How to structure tests in Deno
prompt_templates.prompt: How should I organize test files in my Deno project using the .test.ts convention?

prompt_templates.title: Write test cases
prompt_templates.prompt: What are best practices for writing descriptive test cases that cover edge cases and error handling in Deno?

prompt_templates.title: Run tests
prompt_templates.prompt: How do I run all tests in my project using mise run test? When should I run tests before committing?

prompt_templates.title: Test coverage
prompt_templates.prompt: How do I ensure all public functions and methods have corresponding tests in my Deno project?

output_examples.input: How should I organize test files in my Deno project?
output: Store tests in separate .test.ts files in the same directory as the code being tested
Use descriptive names for test cases to clearly indicate their purpose
Ensure all public functions have corresponding tests
Cover edge cases and error handling in your tests

best_practices: Write tests in separate .test.ts files alongside the code they test
Use descriptive test names that clearly indicate what is being verified
Run tests with mise run test before committing to catch failures early
anti_patterns: Skipping tests for private or internal methods (still important to validate behavior)
Using vague test names that do not explain what the test validates
Ignoring edge cases and only testing the happy path

faq.question: Which testing frameworks are supported?
faq.answer: This skill focuses on Deno's built-in testing framework, which provides robust testing capabilities without external dependencies.

faq.question: What is the maximum project size for testing?
faq.answer: There is no specific limit. The testing practices apply to projects of any size, from small utilities to large applications.

faq.question: How do I integrate with my existing workflow?
faq.answer: Use mise run test to execute tests. Run tests before commits to ensure code quality. The skill integrates with standard Deno development workflows.

faq.question: Is my test data safe?
faq.answer: This skill only provides guidance documentation. It does not access, store, or transmit any test data or files.

faq.question: Why are my tests failing?
faq.answer: Common causes include missing dependencies, incorrect file naming (use .test.ts extension), or tests not in the same directory as source files.

faq.question: How does this compare to other testing skills?
faq.answer: This skill is Deno-specific and focuses on the built-in testing framework. Other skills may cover Jest, Vitest, or other frameworks for different JavaScript environments.
